intro: Hiraea colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian hiraea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
